title: Ticket #1553: CD-ROM creation for VMware jobs fails for some VMs
description:
For a VMware VM universe job, if the user uses the vm_cdrom_files option to have Condor create a CD-ROM image for the VM, the vm gahp will fail if vm already a cd-rom image file associated with it. Specifically, if the .vmx file has a line like this: 

  ide1:0.deviceType = "cdrom-image"

The vm gahp expects the value to be "atapi-cdrom" or "cdrom-raw". "cdrom-image" should be accepted as well. The result would be that the existing cd-rom image would be replaced with the one Condor is asked to create.
check_ins: 2010-Aug-05 13:41   Check-in [18728]: Fix CD-ROM ISO creation for VMware jobs on Windows #1553 For a VMware VM universe job, if the user used the vm_cdrom_files option to have Condor create a CD-ROM image for the VM, the vm gahp would fail if the vm already had a cd-rom image file associated with it.
